New Records: De'Aaron Fox led the way with 33 points, 6 rebounds, and 6 assists, continuing his All-Star level play
Key Match Events: The Kings battled back and used a big third quarter to create separation from the Mavs, ultimately winning 110-100
Sacramento held Dallas to just 40 points in the second half and used their defense to lead to offense, finishing the game with 25 points off 17 Mavericks turnovers
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were missing Luka Dončić, Kyrie Irving, and Klay Thompson
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings two stars led on the court and brought intensity all night
Sacramento has a long way to go to climb back into the Western Conference playoff picture, but tonight was a step in the right direction
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks used a hot start to briefly pull away but fell back to earth once the second quarter started
Sacramento has looked their best this season when they get in the passing lanes and get out in transition
Others: Domantas Sabonis quietly put together a strong performance as well with 17 points and 16 rebounds
